Posts.Content: Feb 1, 2012 11:42AM Lisa75 wrote: I was leaking, and saw mainly tiny wet spots on my tshirts (when at home not wearing a bra)..but huge stains a few times. At times when I could feel like it was leaking, I would take 2 kleenex and place it over that breast and go about what I was doing. That might help.

Posts.Title: Embarassing question.... Emaline jocelynlally

Posts.Content: Mar 15, 2012 10:59PM Lisa75 wrote: I made sure to schedule my surgery away from my cycle, so I had over a week to recover before it hit, but it hit right as I returned to work and was just getting to used to feeling normal. Ive noticed several ladies posting on here a day or two after surgery. I hardly had the energy to even text a friend during that time for me. Its amazing how different it hits us all.
Posts.Title: Embarassing question.... Emaline jocelynlally

Posts.Content: Dec 27, 2011 12:35PM Lisa75 wrote: I have grade 2 DCIS and my surgeon only recommended lumpectomy. no rads or tamoxifen. yet....we are waiting for my MRI which I will have done next week. I was a little surprised considering everything I had read that radiation just naturally came with lumpectomy.
